sections.paragraph_title:
Adbourne Film Festival
You will hear a talk on local radio about a ‘short film’ festival in the town of Adbourne.

instructions.main_head_002: Choose the correct answer A, B, or C.

questions.text:
Questions 11-16
Choose the correct answer A, B or C
11. Why was the Film Festival started?
options: A To encourage local people to make films.
B To bring more tourists to the town.
C To use money released from another project.
questions.correct_answer: C To use money released from another project.

questions.text: 12. What is the price range for tickets?
13. As well as online, tickets for the films can be obtained
options: A from the local library.
B from several different shops.
C from the two festival cinemas.

questions.text: 14. Last year’s winning film was about
options: A farms of the future.
B schools and the environment.
C green transport options.

questions.text: 15. This year the competition prize is
options: A a stay in a hotel.
B film-making equipment.
C a sum of money.

questions.text: 16. The deadline for entering a film in the competition is the end of
options: A May.
B June.
C July.

questions.text:
Questions 17 and 18
Choose TWO letters A-E
What TWO main criteria are used to judge the film competition?
options: A Ability to persuade.
B Quality of the story.
C Memorable characters.
D Quality of photography.
E Originality.

questions.text:
Questions 19 and 20
Choose TWO letters A-E
What TWO changes will be made to the competition next year?
options: A A new way of judging
B A different length of time
C An additional age category
D Different performance times
E New locations for performances

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 3 - Questions 21-24. Choose the correct letter A, B, or C.

questions.text: 21. Leela and Jake chose this article because
options: A it was on a topic familiar to most students.
B it covered both IT and education issues.
C it dealt with a very straightforward concept.
questions.correct_answer: C it dealt with a very straightforward concept.

questions.text: 22. How did Leela and Jake persuade students to take part in their research?
options: A They convinced them they would enjoy the experience.
B They said it would help them do a particular test.
C They offered to help them with their own research later on.
questions.correct_answer: B They said it would help them do a particular test.

questions.text: 23. Leela and Jake changed the design of the original questionnaire because
options: A it was too short for their purposes.
B it asked misleading questions.
C it contained out-of-date points.

questions.text: 24. Leela was surprised by the fact that
options: A it is normal for questionnaire returns to be low.
B so many students sent back their questionnaires.
C the questionnaire responses were of such high quality.
questions.correct_answer: A it is normal for questionnaire returns to be low.

questions.text:
Questions 25 and 26
What TWO things did respondents say they liked most about doing the crossword?
options: A It helped them spell complex technical terms.
B It was an enjoyable experience.
C It helped them concentrate effectively.
D It increased their general motivation to study.
E It showed what they still needed to study.
correct_answer: C It helped them concentrate effectively.
E It showed what they still needed to study.

questions.text:
Questions 27 and 28
In which TWO areas did these research findings differ from those of the original study?
options: A Students’ interest in doing similar exercises.
B How much students liked doing the crossword.
C Time taken to do the crossword.
D Gender differences in appreciation.
E Opinions about using crosswords for formal assessment.
correct_answer: E Opinions about using crosswords for formal assessment.

questions.text:
Questions 29 and 30
What TWO skills did Leela and Jake agree they had learned from the project?
options: A How to manage their time effectively.
B How to process numerical data.
C How to design research tools.
D How to reference other people’s work.
E How to collaborate in research.
correct_answer: C How to design research tools.
E How to collaborate in research.
